title: TSM vs Gravity
body: That was the most entertaining game of professional league I've seen this season. I think I can say for once this season the balancing team has done their job. This is a good time to stop complaining for a bit and celebrate what we have. And what we have is TSM losing against urgot mid. How much better can it get?

replies.body: obviously u didnt watch UoL vs Fnatic yesterday, if u say that was the most entertaining game of the season.

> [{quoted}](name=Zazusha,realm=NA,application-id=9hBQwnEU,discussion-id=ZyeLEtaN,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2015-03-21T22:22:59.771+0000)
>
> obviously u didnt watch UoL vs Fnatic yesterday, if u say that was the most entertaining game of the season.

I actually did haha, and while I enjoyed it, I've been waiting for urgod's time for a while now

> [{quoted}](name=Zazusha,realm=NA,application-id=9hBQwnEU,discussion-id=ZyeLEtaN,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2015-03-21T22:22:59.771+0000)
>
> obviously u didnt watch UoL vs Fnatic yesterday, if u say that was the most entertaining game of the season.

yeah but, its EU man cmon.
























lol jk jk, not gonna shit on EU too much.
Seriously though. Go watch that game XD
Ya, second most exciting game.  The meta was turned on its head.  Urgot to be kidding me Yor(p)icking these champions

Gravity truly performed an amazing upset and I do believe that it will forever change the concept of meta champions and broaden people's horizon's when it comes to counterpicking. That or people will just whine til urgot is nerfed.
It's easier to nerf urgot, since he's already getting reworked.  Say goodbye to the mana scaling on that sheild.

> [{quoted}](name=Remlap1223,realm=NA,application-id=9hBQwnEU,discussion-id=ZyeLEtaN,comment-id=00030000,timestamp=2015-03-22T00:01:04.039+0000)
>
> It's easier to nerf urgot, since he's already getting reworked.  Say goodbye to the mana scaling on that sheild.

3 years later...
Now I doubt Riot would nerf Urgot after one game.......2 maybe,but 1 is too early to tell.
You know, I hate to say it, but Urgot was such a smart pick there.  Gravity read TSM's comp really well.

> [{quoted}](name=CC Shepherd,realm=NA,application-id=9hBQwnEU,discussion-id=ZyeLEtaN,comment-id=0006,timestamp=2015-03-22T00:43:38.528+0000)
>
> You know, I hate to say it, but Urgot was such a smart pick there.  Gravity read TSM's comp really well.

+keane actually play a lot of urgot mid. It was just the perfect setup for the pick. And it delivered.
[https://twitter.com/GVKeane/status/551890335258128385](https://twitter.com/GVKeane/status/551890335258128385)

the second "most entertaining game of professional league I've seen this season" you mean
UOL vs FNC was much more exciting.

urgot mid won in lcs

boy i wonder what happens next
Oh god my sides.  Professional games are actually starting to get decent, who knew?
It was really nice seeing the one true Urgod shit on the cancer that is Zed.That game and the UoL vs FNC game.Why is LCS getting good all of a sudden?

> [{quoted}](name=Skaianite,realm=NA,application-id=9hBQwnEU,discussion-id=ZyeLEtaN,comment-id=000d,timestamp=2015-03-22T06:17:07.386+0000)
>
> It was really nice seeing the one true Urgod shit on the cancer that is Zed.That game and the UoL vs FNC game.Why is LCS getting good all of a sudden?

Urgot counters zed xD

So. Based on last season's victorious skin, the champ who rocked the lcs-world the hardest got the skin, Morgana being that champ last season.


... Victorious Urgot anybody? ;)

TSM lost?

Gravity won...?

YES!
Dont forget about Yorick Morri (UoL vs FNC)

The meta isn't constructed by Riot. The meta can shift. 2 months ago if someone picked Urgot mid vs. a Zed, he'd get flamed and possibly even reported for trolling. Keane did it and his Urgot shut down Bjergsen's Zed with his ultimate every single time he went in.

Rather than complaining about whatever champions are in-meta, you can simply adapt and shift the meta, and this game along with the UoL vs Fnatic game just goes to show what that really means.

People need to stop complaining and start analyzing.
they balance champions around roles how much more meta can it get?
Best part was late game where Keane "swapped" with Turtle. And Turtle just got NUKED.

Tsm trolled entire game. If you think about it you could tell they would do this. They where saying prior that if they lost gravity ( a weak team) would get a play off pick. Meaning they would bet gravity with a ( o god the all ad comp xD no they would go a reg comp)  good comp. ITs all planned, so dont jusmp on TSM U SUCK AHAHAHA train when in truth you could smell the troll.
This makes absolutely no sense. Who prefers losing over winning?

> [{quoted}](name=EpameisGR,realm=EUNE,application-id=9hBQwnEU,discussion-id=ZyeLEtaN,comment-id=000c0000,timestamp=2015-03-22T10:28:52.183+0000)
>
> This makes absolutely no sense. Who prefers losing over winning?

While I second the "absolutely no sense" statement, sports like boxing sometimes give more money if a boxer loses just to increase the popularity of the "winner"

First of all I didn't downvote your comment although I see it on "0". Secondly, boxing has nothing to do with esports and most teams spend a lot of time training just to win. So especially in GV vs TSM where TSM needed a win to secure the first place they can't have lost on purpose.

> [{quoted}](name=EpameisGR,realm=EUNE,application-id=9hBQwnEU,discussion-id=ZyeLEtaN,comment-id=000c000000000000,timestamp=2015-03-22T21:38:09.556+0000)
>
> First of all I didn't downvote your comment although I see it on "0". Secondly, boxing has nothing to do with esports and most teams spend a lot of time training just to win. So especially in GV vs TSM where TSM needed a win to secure the first place they can't have lost on purpose.

Im not sayiing that they did lose on purpose. I made the analogy to say that doing it is entirely possible, no matter if it's in sports or esports. Corruption comes in many different ways, maybe eventually or promptly, and we can't be too trusty even if the games appear to be safe.

Saint himself said post-game he felt that TSM underplayed significantly. I'm not one to down gravity because I really like saint and as a former navy sailor myself i'm happy to see him representing veterans. But I think TSM's mind is on play-offs and they probably weren't too serious on this game. 

That being said, I do think tsm underestimated the impact of the new patch and the adaptations being made in lcs. Hopefully it doesn't become their achille's in play offs.
I recommend you to watch UOL v FNC, where UOL won with... Yorick! Anyways, Gravity won not just because of the URGOD, but because Dyrus died repeatedly... #damnitdyrone.

TSM historically does poorly whenever dyrus does poorly. He did poorly in that game.

And I really really really dispise saint.

> [{quoted}](name=Yung Gates TiZM,realm=NA,application-id=9hBQwnEU,discussion-id=ZyeLEtaN,comment-id=,timestamp=2015-03-21T22:22:05.284+0000)
>
> ...How much better can it get?

Well, if CLG beats them tomorrow playing Poppy, Evelynn, Kog'Maw, Garen, and Shen, I think it would top that.
